title: Touchpad and Keyboard Work in Linux...that's about it
comment: The keyboard support is smooth, but most of my extended keys don't work (alt+tab, home, end, etc.).  The touchpad is pretty puny with only 1 mouse button and vertical-only scroll.  The support for VLC is pretty poor and doesn't seem to work at all in Linux.  I had to install a dev package to even get the server running, which crashes every time I try to play a file on the computer or change the settings.  Streaming to my phone (beta) works fine for audio (even plays in background), but the video has issues with some of the blocks having black lines.  The web feature (beta) opens up Firefox, which I only have installed because of web-dev work I do.  I can only assume this is one of the settings that can be changed (literally, since the settings menu crashes the server).  It works for some things, but I get the mobile versions of pages.  YouTube sadly does not work well.  Somehow the URL in the phone browser isn't getting updated, except once when it failed to go back to the first page, and tapping on the big play icon to start the video does nothing.

title: My most useful app - WIFI video/audio streaming
comment: The "phone" mode works great on my Google Asus Nexus 7 tablet. It plays all videos using the best video player app (by far) DicePlayer. Very simple to use both as server (PC) side and client phone-tablet side. I have a 2TB USB 3.0 hard drive with tons of video files always connected to my Lenovo notebook. Even though my wi-fi network for both PC and tablet is only 802.11g (not n), videos play flawlessly (MP4 MPG MKV WMV AVI FLV MOV).  I previously tried to set up a local nginx HTTP server and Fillazilla FTP server to access my remote files. Not only are these more complicated to set up but I never got them to work on my network with the N7 tablet.  The only significant failing of GMOTE is audio files. Unlike video files, where GMOTE passes off the actual video player function to your favorites video app like DicePlayer, BSPlayer, or MXPlayer, GMOTE tries to handle the audio files itself. This works okay for MP3 and FLAC files but totally fails for  WMA files. I think it would be better if GMOTE also passed off the audio file playing function to an external audio app such as doubleTwist, etc., more specialized for audio.  Minor: directory structure could also use improvement.

And I know that it's allowing my phone and computer to talk to each other (no firewall problem) because I can use the "mouse" feature *AND* I can play songs from my computer on my phone (the experimental Beta function). When I to do what it's supposed to do (play VLC on computer) it fails *MISERABLY*. And the "Community Forum" seems to never have anyone from the developer answering people's questions or comments.
